Halifax footballers banned from league

Second and third years of the Halifax firsts football team have being banned from competing this term after causing substantial damage on their 'World tour' of campus social (Thumbnail credit Photocredit: Agatha Torrance)

Proposed degree overhaul to impact first year students

By James Bithell

The University is considering introducing a reports scheme that could supplant the traditional honours grading system (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: aldisley)

New Langwith accepts first students

By James Bithell

Hundreds of students have moved into new Langwith accommodation on Heslington East, as the college makes the move to the new campus (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Laura Hughes)

YUSU's relationship with Salvation sours

Club Salvation decided to run their F**K ME! York University Night on Monday, despite concerns raised to the local nightclub by the University of York Students' Union (YUSU) (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Andorpro)

York climbs eighteen places in world rankings

"We are very pleased that York has leapt 18 places in the THE World Rankings. We will, however, not be happy until York is back in the top 100 where it belongs." (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Laura Hughes)

University accommodation complaints double

The number of complaints about the University's rented accommodation have more than doubled in the past year. Halifax appears to have suffered significant problems, with half of the complaints last year coming from this college (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Philippa Grafton)

University hosts newly elected Green leader

Natalie Bennett, the newly elected leader of the Green Party, is to deliver a talk at the University on Wednesday 24th October

College porters still "over-stretched"

Following a PS2m investment in the student experience, the University has put in place night-time staffing in colleges without 24 hour porters for the start of this term

GSA President steps down

Karin Diaconu, the University's Graduate Students' Association (GSA) President, will be stepping down from her position for the current academic year (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: nanbudao)

STYC contract bans negative comments

Criticism has been launched by certain students against a clause in the STYC contract

Student takes land grab fight to London

Harriet Milligan, University of York student and Oxfam campaigner, took part in Thursday's international protest in London (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: York Oxfam Society)

YUSU in continued talks with First over bus service

YUSU are in continuing discussions with First regarding their decision to scrap the number 4 bus service to Heslington East campus (Thumbnail credit Phtoto credit: johnnyg1955)

University still advertising clearing spaces a week before the start of term

York was the only member of the elite Russell Group that was still advertising spaces in clearing last week. The University was one of 110 universities and higher education colleges that were still seeking students from Britain and the EU to join them ahead of the start of term (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Sam Newsome)

YUSU satisfaction rate: 61 per cent

Student satisfaction of the University of York students' union (YUSU) has been ranked at 61 per cent compared to 88 per cent for the University, according to this year's National Student Survey (NSS)

Name needed for third Heslington East college

The next stage of the Heslington East development is already well under way with a brand new third college on the new campus expected to be built for the start of the 2014/15 academic year

In pictures: York suffers worst floods for 12 years

By James Bithell

The city was hit by rapid floods two weeks ago which brought large scale chaos to the centre of York. Roads were closed blocking off many routes meaning it could take hours to get from one end of the city to another (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: alh1)

VC to depart December next year

The University has confirmed that Brian Cantor, the University Vice-Chancellor, will be stepping down from his post on 31st December 2013

First impressions

As the latest students to join the University, Alex Slingsby, Laura Hughes and Neil Johnston caught up with a few fresh faces

The Glasshouse: In pictures

The new Glasshouse bar opened on Monday this week with the official welcome night on Tuesday. The newest addition to the bars on campus is located in Langwith College on Heslington East

Professor Green announced as Live & Loud Headliner

Kallum Taylor, YUSU President, announced Professor Green would be the headlining act for Freshers event Live 'n' Loud. (Thumbnail credit Eva Rinaldi Celebrity and Live Music Photographer)

YUSU condemn decision to scrap free Hes East bus link

YUSU has condemned the decision and absence of consultation by First Buses to scrap the free service operating between Heslington East and West. (Thumbnail credit Georgi Mabee)

York Sport Village opens for business

The new York Sport Village on Heslington East officially opened to the public for the first time today (Thumbnail credit Image: York Sport)

Student consultation for new Vice Chancellor

Students at the University are being offered the opportunity to partake in the process of hiring the University's new Vice Chancellor. Three preliminary briefings are now available to students, with the recruitment firm, Odgers Berndtson. (Thumbnail credit Brian Cantor is to set down as Vice-Chancellor next year Photo credit: Georgi Mabee)

Accommodation selection process criticised once again

Despite talk of reform on the University's Accommodation Application process, this year's accommodation selection procedure has received very similar criticism (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Peter Iveson)

York Mystery Plays: "Community theatre on a huge scale"

Last Thursday, over a thousand audience members from around the country gathered in Museum Gardens for the opening night of the York Mystery Plays. (Thumbnail credit Photo Credit: alh1)

City of York to boost connections with China

The City of York is hoping to boost its connections with China by building on links already forged by the University (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: ospalh)

Olympic teams cancel York training base

The University has said it is "disappointed" that it will not be used as a training base for Olympic athletes during the London 2012 Games after teams hit funding problems (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: duncan)

International students left in limbo by visa delays

Kallum Taylor, YUSU President, says "we will be contacting the Home Office, and our two local MPs" about the visa delays (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: TheTransparentEyeball)

YUSU will "lead the way" in national student protest

The new YUSU President Kallum Taylor, has said that YUSU will "lead the way" at a national demonstration in November against changes to higher education (Thumbnail credit In November 2010 students from York marched in London against the rise in tuition fees - Photo credit: Sam Newsome)

University staff treated to premium iPads and iPhones

It has emerged that the University has spent over PS35,000 on providing staff with iPads and iPhones (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: KOMINYETSKA)
